// webapp/frontend/src/components/WaterTraceDashboard.js import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import { LineChart, Line, XAxis, YAxis, CartesianGrid, Tooltip, Legend, ResponsiveContainer } from 'recharts'; import { Card, CardHeader, CardTitle, CardContent } from './ui/card'; import { Tabs, TabsContent, TabsList, TabsTrigger } from './ui/tabs'; import GroundwaterMap from './GroundwaterMap'; const WaterTraceDashboard = () => { const [historicalData, setHistoricalData] = useState([]); const [recentData, setRecentData] = useState([]); const [combinedData, setCombinedData] = useState([]); const [summary, setSummary] = useState(null); const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true); useEffect(() => { fetchData(); }, []); const fetchData = async () => { try { // Fetch all data const [historicalRes, recentRes, summaryRes] = await Promise.all([ fetch('/api/historical/timeseries'), fetch('/api/recent/timeseries'), fetch('/api/analysis/summary') ]); const historical = await historicalRes.json(); const recent = await recentRes.json(); const summaryData = await summaryRes.json(); setHistoricalData(historical.data || []); setRecentData(recent.data || []); // Combine historical and recent data for overview const combined = [ ...(historical.data || []).map(d => ({ ...d, source: 'GRACE (Historical)' })), ...(recent.data || []).map(d => ({ ...d, source: 'GLDAS (Recent)' })) ].sort((a, b) => new Date(a.date) - new Date(b.date)); setCombinedData(combined); setSummary(summaryData); setLoading(false); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching data:', error); setLoading(false); } }; if (loading) { return
Loading WaterTrace Dashboard...
; } return (
{/* Header */}

 {/* Historical Tab */} Historical Groundwater Trends (GRACE 2002-2017) [value, 'Groundwater Anomaly (cm)']} /> {/* Recent Tab */} Recent Water Status (GLDAS 2018-2024) [value, 'Deep Soil Moisture (m³/m³)']} /> {/* Comparison Tab */}

Soil moisture proxy for groundwater

Monthly averages from 3-hourly data

 Key Findings {summary && (
    {summary.key_findings.map((finding, index) => (
  • ✓ {finding}
    • ))}
)}
{/* Conclusion Tab */} Research Conclusion: 22 Years of Groundwater Monitoring

Critical Water Crisis in Pakistan (2002-2024)

Historical Period (2002-2017)

  • • Severe Depletion: -13.71 cm total groundwater loss
  • • Annual Decline: -0.81 cm/year consistent depletion
  • • Average State: -1.85 cm below normal levels
  • • Statistical Significance: p-value < 0.001 (highly significant)

Recent Period (2018-2024)

  • • Recovery Signs: +10.30 cm improvement
  • • Current Status: 254.55 cm average level
  • • Trend Reversal: Increasing groundwater levels
  • • Data Source: GLDAS deep soil moisture proxy

Key Findings & Implications

1. Long-term Water Stress: Pakistan experienced severe groundwater depletion for 15+ years, likely due to:

  • Excessive groundwater pumping for agriculture
  • Rapid urbanization and increased water demand
  • Climate change impacts on precipitation patterns
  • Inefficient irrigation practices

2. Recent Recovery (Post-2018): The positive trend suggests:

  • Possible policy interventions showing results
  • Improved water management practices
  • Better monsoon patterns in recent years
  • Increased awareness and conservation efforts

3. Seasonal Variations: Data shows significant seasonal patterns:

  • Lowest levels: January, May, November (dry months)
  • Highest levels: July-August (monsoon season)
  • Critical stress periods require targeted management

Recommendations for Sustainable Water Future

  1. Continue Monitoring: Maintain satellite-based surveillance to track progress
  2. Policy Enforcement: Strengthen groundwater extraction regulations
  3. Agricultural Reform: Promote drip irrigation and water-efficient crops
  4. Rainwater Harvesting: Implement large-scale collection systems
  5. Public Awareness: Educate communities about water conservation
  6. Regional Planning: Develop district-specific water management strategies

"While the recent recovery is encouraging, Pakistan must remain vigilant. The 15-year depletion period serves as a stark warning about unsustainable water use. Continued monitoring and proactive management are essential to ensure water security for future generations."

{/* Footer */}

Tayyab Manan

GIS Developer & Data Analyst

© 2024 WaterTrace - Monitoring Pakistan's Water Resources

); }; export default WaterTraceDashboard;
